scenarioDescription:
The TrES-2 Exoplanetary System


Overview

TrES-2 is a star with 1.36 times the mass of the Sun, and 1.12 times its radius. It is located 702.28 light years away from the solar system and is estimated to be 3.55 billion years old, as compared to the Sun which is roughly 4.6 billion years old.

TrES-2 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the TrES-2 system


TrES-2 b

TrES-2 b was discovered by the TrES observatory, in 2006-11, using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is 0.04 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of TrES-2 b is 473.820 times the mass of Earth. The radius of TrES-2 b is 15.244 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, TrES-2 b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system TrES-2, which contains 1 exoplanets and was discovered by the TrES.
name: TrES-2 - System With 1 Exoplanet
